Hi Bhupinder and All folks!

Please, could you tell me how your have success to
convert a ck file to cti, using ck2cti of version
1.6.0, where the number of a given specie is greater
than 9? I did try several ways to do it and I had not
success. I attached in my previous e-mail two
mechanism   files, both with 'C7H16 + 11O2' reactants.
The ck2cti replays the following error message:

Syntax error: undeclared reactant species 1O2  (line
8)

When I change to, for example, 'C7H16 + 9O2 + 2O2' no
error apears.
I looked for the code parts where the parse is donne
and I found that in the lines 112 and 113 of
CKParser.cpp:

112:  else if (ch != '.' && (ch < '0' || ch > '9')) {
113:     return UNDEF;
114:  }

It seems that the parser have a limitation about the
number of a given specie in the reaction, which must
to be 0<=N<=9! Am I right?

I did see that the converted file that you sent us
have '11 O2' in the reactions. How you did it?

Please, can you or somebody help me? 

Many tanks in advance for your help and for any that
can help me.

Wladimyr
